item.title: Larks Ant
item.author: my.toe.ben@gmail.com (Jason Duong)
item.description: Link to Source Code Online Demo1 $q$ = $T_{ij}$ = $\theta$ = $\text{counter}$ = Fig. 1: Larks Ant Demo Introduction Definition 1: Larks Ant is a 2D cellular automaton $\mathcal{A}$ that consists of a pair set of states $\mathbf{Q}$, a quadruple of colors $\Sigma$, an initial state $q_0\in\mathbf{Q}$, a local variable $\text{counter}$, and a transition function $\delta_\mathcal{A}:\mathbf{Q}\times\Sigma\to\mathbf{Q}\times\Sigma\times\theta$ where $$\mathbf{Q}\in\lbrace\text{Normal, Countdown}\rbrace.\\ \Sigma\in(\text{Black, Blue, Yellow, Red}).\\ -\frac{\pi}{2}\le\theta\le\frac{\pi}{2}.$$ Let $T=\mathbb{Z}^2$ represent a two-dimensional grid.
